title: Prophet Ishaq (AS)
introduction: Prophet Ishaq (Isaac) was the second son of Prophet Ibrahim (AS) and the son of Sarah, born to them in old age as a miracle and clear sign of Allah’s power. His story shows us the truth of Allah’s promises, the blessings that come with patience and trust, and the importance of righteous families raising generations who worship Allah alone.

sections.heading: Birth and Early Life
sections.content: Sarah and Ibrahim (AS) remained patient for many years without a child, yet they never lost hope in Allah’s mercy. When the angels visited Ibrahim (AS) to deliver the news of the punishment for the people of Lut, they also brought him glad tidings of a righteous son, Ishaq. Sarah was amazed and laughed in disbelief, asking how she could bear a child in her old age while Ibrahim was also elderly. The angels reassured them that Allah does whatever He wills, showing that His power is limitless. The birth of Ishaq was a miracle that strengthened their faith and brought immense joy to their family. This moment reminds us that Allah can open doors and grant miracles when we least expect it, as long as we trust Him.

sections.heading: Continuation of Prophethood
sections.content: Prophet Ishaq (AS) grew up in the household of Ibrahim (AS), learning the importance of Tawheed, patience, and guiding others with wisdom. Allah chose Ishaq as a prophet, and he continued his father’s mission of calling people to worship Allah alone. Through Ishaq’s lineage came his son Yaqub (Jacob) (AS), who became known as Israel, and from him came the tribes of Bani Israel. This noble lineage included many prophets, such as Yusuf, Musa, Harun, Dawud, Sulayman, and Isa (peace be upon them all). The Quran says: *'And We gave him good tidings of Ishaq, a prophet from among the righteous. And We blessed him and Ishaq.'* (Quran 37:112-113). This shows that when a family holds firmly to faith and righteousness, their legacy continues to spread goodness for generations.

sections.heading: Lessons from Ishaq's Story
sections.content: Ishaq’s story teaches us powerful lessons. First, it shows that no matter how impossible something seems, Allah can make it happen — He simply says *'Be,'* and it is. This gives us hope when facing hardships or waiting for long-held prayers to be answered. Second, Ishaq’s life shows us the importance of raising our children with strong faith and good character. He learned from his father, and he passed on the same devotion to his own son, Yaqub (AS). Finally, his story reminds us to stay patient and grateful through every test. Families who remain firm in worship and trust in Allah build generations who can carry on righteousness and benefit the world.

conclusion: Prophet Ishaq’s life reminds us that Allah’s promises always come true, no matter how impossible they may seem to us. His story inspires us to be patient, trust in Allah’s wisdom, and nurture our families in faith and goodness. May we follow his example by building strong families rooted in belief and passing on a legacy of righteousness for generations to come.
